title.narrative: Diakonia: Supporting People for a Dignified Life 2020-2024
Diakonia: Supporting People for a Dignified Life 2020-2024

description.narrative:
Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Diakonia has applied for funding from Sida with a total amount of SEK 110 000 000 to implement its programme entitled “Supporting People for a Dignified Life” in Cambodia during the period of 2020-2024. As the Swedish Strategy for development cooperation with Cambodia is extended to 2020, the Embassy therefore decides to grant support to Diakonia for a period of four years starting from 1 January 2020 to 31 December 2023, with the total amount of SEK 87 500 000.
Building on experiences and results from the previous programme, the new programme’s overall objective is “a strengthened civil society with the capacity to widen democratic space and promote human rights and gender equality so Cambodian people can lead peaceful, dignified lives with access to fundamental rights and freedoms”.

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Diakonia har inkommit med en ansökan om stöd från Sida på ett totalt belopp på SEK 110 000 000 för genomförande av sitt program "Supporting People for a Dignified Life" i Kambodja under perioden 2020-2024. Den gällande svenska strategin för utvecklingssamarbete med Kambodja är förlängd till och med 2020, och därför beslutar Sida att ingå avtal med Diakonia under fyra av programmets fem år, från och med 1 januari 2020 till 31 december 2023, med ett totalt bidrag av SEK 87 500 000.
Insatsen bygger på Diakonias tidigare erfarenheter och resultat av tidigare stöd. Insatsen syftar till att stärka det kambodjanska civilsamhället med kapacitet att utvidga det demokratiska utrymmet samt främja mänskliga rättigheter och jämställdhet så att människor i Kambodja kan leva fredliga, värdiga liv med tillgång till grundläggande rättigheter och friheter. Insatsen har ett speciellt fokus på kvinnor och jämställdhet samt på stöd till utsatta grupper i Kambodja.

The development objective of the program from Diakonia’s context analysis is to contribute to a just, equal and sustainable Cambodia free from poverty, oppression, inequality and violence. The overall objective for the program is; A strengthened civil society with the capacity to widen democratic space and promote human rights and gender equality so Cambodian people can lead peaceful, dignified lives with access to fundamental rights and freedoms. The overall objective has four underlying objectives that will all contribute to a strengthened civil society. The objectives are; Human Rights Objective: Rights holders', grassroots communities', and CSO's capacity strengthened to advocate for a functioning rule of law as well as respect and promotion of Human Rights, which benefits all. Result 1: Affected communities, works and HRD’s access legal, social and technical support to mitigate their own risk and continue their work Result 2: Community actions and demands are heard by duty bearers (government and corporations) and are addressed accordingly Democracy Objective: Rights holders, grassroots communities and CSOs supported to strengthen their capability for widening democratic space in Cambodia, which benefits all. Result 1: Well informed rights holders are engaged in democratic processes and dialogue with duty bearers, contributing to widening democratic space Result 2: Communities are organized and take initiatives for policy dialogue and advocacy with duty bearers, to influence and hold them accountable Gender Equality Objective: Women, men and boys and girls empowered and strengthened to exercise their rights for gender equality, hold government accountable to their commitments and contribute to reducing gender-based violence in community and society. Result 1: Strengthening women’s participation and leadership, contributing to and promoting local good governance Result 2: Promoted social justice to achieve gender equality Objectives for strengthening partners: Partners are empowered and strengthened to achieve organizational and programmatic sustainability. Result 1: Partners are supported and protected in a closing space for civil society Result 2: Partners increased thematic and organizational capacity and formed synergies with other like-minded actors Result 3: Partners have mobilized resources and have utilized funds in a transparent and accountable manner Result 4: Partners are enabled to fulfill their development priorities effectively Result 5: Partners work is supported and complemented by Diakonia’s awareness raising and advocacy in Sweden and Europe. Result 6: Partner’s knowledge and access to existing emergency funds have increased

tag.narrative: 1.1 - By 2030, eradicate extreme poverty for all people everywhere, currently measured as people living on less than $1.25 a day.
1.1 - Senast 2030 avskaffa den extrema fattigdomen för alla människor överallt. Med extrem fattigdom avses för närvarande människor som lever på mindre än 1,25 US-dollar per dag.
10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
17.14 - Enhance policy coherence for sustainable development.
17.14 - Föra en mer samstämmig politik för hållbar utveckling.
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
